title: 00x13: Certificates of Divestiture and Judges on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces
summary: A judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces (CAAF) would not qualify as an “eligible person” for a Certificate of Divestiture, pursuant to 26 U.S.C. § 1043(b)(1)(A). CAAF judges are not executive branch employees.
